Author: jttp
Title: [ANN] Crypto
Body: Our friends at Modular have a great explanation for you: "Token sales in the past have faced many issues, most notably the tradeoffs between capped and uncapped sales. In a capped sale, there is a chance that some buyers will not get to the sale in time and be excluded. In an uncapped sale, the buyers have no idea what the total valuation will be and thus have no guarantee of what percentage of the total tokens they will be buying. The interactive crowdsale protocol aims to solve both of these issues by allowing the market to decide the valuation through a series of bids that everyone is allowed to participate in. This is accomplished by having participants submit what is called a personal valuation cap, in addition to the regular ETH payment for tokens." - https://medium.com/modular-network/building-the-interactive-token-sale-1545514bf108  We have published our thoughts on the Interactive Coin Offering in our own Medium article: https://medium.com/tvtwocom/what-icos-should-look-like-in-2018-a96eda686a9b  You will just need MetaMask and our website to participate. A detailed explainer video will follow in April. The code of the smart contract is up on GitHub: https://github.com/TrueBitFoundation/interactive-coin-offerings

Title: [ANN] Crypto
Body: The Token for Television (TTV)  gives the holder the right to display ads to users on the platform. Advertisers want to acquire it from participants in the crowdsale to get reach on the Big Screen.  Since the number of TTV is fixed after the crowdsale, each issued token possesses the right to show sponsored messaged to a defined percentage of consumers that watch television through TV-TWO. If the absolute number of consumers using TV-TWO grows over time, the inherent utility of each token increases. The anticipation of greater utility in the future will cause market participants to hold on to TTV and increase the price. For participants, Network Utility Expansion describes the mechanism that has the power to lead to an appreciation of the TTV compared to other assets.
